text: - I am a US citizen.

And my brother is a
green card holder.

And he would be eligible
for US citizen next month.

He went to Dubai for
work for one week.
He's a green card holder.

And according to the travel
ban that Mr. Trump has issued,

he's going to be
banned from coming
back to the United States.

- My parents have
a dual citizenship
from Sweden and Iran.

They do not get
to visit me often.

But they have been
to the visa interview

for traveling to
the United States.

And they have a
ticket for February 4.

And now because of
this ban, they will not
be able to come and visit me.

- My sister is a
green card holder.

And she has applied for her
husband to get his green card.
And he was approved.

And now with the ban, they
cannot travel to US anymore
and his visa will expire.

If this ban continues,
my sister cannot
ever come back to the US again.

- My nieces and nephews are held
at Washington Dulles airport.

The family consists of a
mother, three children who

are US citizens, and three
children who have immigration
visa to the United States.

We've been informed that the US
citizens can enter the country

but the rest of the family
need to be deported.

- I'm Iranian with
a dual citizenship.
I live in the United States.

But my mom comes here and
visits me every few months.
She's a green card holder.

She is worried about
coming here now.

If a green card holder doesn't
visit the United States

or stays out of
the United States

for more than six
months, there's a risk
of losing your green card.
[music playing]
